overview:
Alexander Stojanovic is the founder, architect, and general manager of the group responsible for Apache Hadoop(tm) for Windows Azure and Windows Server at Microsoft. He is currently driving engineering and business strategy for the team within the Business Platforms Division.

Previously, Alexander founded and managed a peta-scale predictive analytics startup as part of the Windows Azure platform. He was founder and architect of the Microsoft Solver Foundation, a .Net/CLR-based system for mathematical programming and combinatorial optimization used in Microsoft’s online advertising (adCenter) and Dynamics ERP systems. He has designed the core Internet-scale data access Java frameworks for Microsoft that were part of Visual J++ (Microsoft JVM). Alexander founded and managed teams focused on enterprise-focused semantic indexing and probabilistic search for Microsoft SQL Server. This work embodies his strong interest in techniques of emergent semantics, statistical linguistics, and probabilistic logics.

He worked at BEA Systems as Director of Engineering for the award winning WebLogic Integration 8.1 product suite. His professional career began with designing and implementing real-time analytics systems in C++ for the financial services industry.

Alexander studied at the University of Belgrade and is a graduate of Santa Clara University (BA with honors, 1990).
